009package imagingbook.testutils;
010
011import static org.junit.Assert.assertEquals;
012
013
014import org.junit.Assert;
015
016public abstract class NumericTestUtils {
017        
018        private NumericTestUtils() {}
019        
020        public static float TOLERANCE = 1E-6f;
021        
022        // utility methods for comparing 2D arrays ---------------------------------------------------------------
023        
024        public static void assertArrayEquals(double[][] expecteds, double[][] actuals) {
025                assertArrayEquals(expecteds, actuals, TOLERANCE);
026        }
027
028        public static void assertArrayEquals(double[][] expecteds, double[][] actuals, double delta) {
029                Assert.assertEquals(expecteds.length, actuals.length);
030                for (int i = 0; i < expecteds.length; i++) {
031                        Assert.assertArrayEquals(expecteds[i], actuals[i], delta);
032                }
033        }
034        
035        public static void assertArrayEquals(float[][] expecteds, float[][] actuals) {
036                assertArrayEquals(expecteds, actuals, TOLERANCE);
037        }
038
039        public static void assertArrayEquals(float[][] expecteds, float[][] actuals, double delta) {
040                Assert.assertEquals(expecteds.length, actuals.length);
041                for (int i = 0; i < expecteds.length; i++) {
042                        Assert.assertArrayEquals(expecteds[i], actuals[i], (float) delta);
043                }
044        }
045        
046        public static void assertArrayEquals(int[][] expecteds, int[][] actuals) {
047                Assert.assertEquals(expecteds.length, actuals.length);
048                for (int i = 0; i < expecteds.length; i++) {
049                        Assert.assertArrayEquals(expecteds[i], actuals[i]);
050                }
051        }
052        
053        public static void assertArrayEquals(byte[][] expecteds, byte[][] actuals) {
054                Assert.assertEquals(expecteds.length, actuals.length);
055                for (int i = 0; i < expecteds.length; i++) {
056                        Assert.assertArrayEquals(expecteds[i], actuals[i]);
057                }
058        }
059        
060        // comparison by relative magnitude -------------------------------------------------------
061        
062        public static void assertEqualsRelative(double expected, double actual, double relDelta) {
063                double maxAbs = Math.max(Math.abs(expected), Math.abs(actual));
064                // if magnitude of both values is less than relDelta we don't check any more:
065                if (maxAbs < relDelta)
066                        return;
067                double delta = maxAbs * relDelta;
068//              System.out.format(Locale.US, "x=%f y=%f delta=%f\n", expected, actual, delta);
069                assertEquals(null, expected, actual, delta);
070        }
071        
072        
073        public static void assertArrayEqualsRelative(double[] expecteds, double[] actuals, double relDelta) {
074                Assert.assertEquals(expecteds.length, actuals.length);
075                for (int i = 0; i < expecteds.length; i++) {
076                        assertEqualsRelative(expecteds[i], actuals[i], relDelta);
077                }
078        }
079
080        
081//      public static void main(String[] args) {
082//              assertEqualsRelative(1.0000000000, 1.0000000001, 1e-6);
083//              assertEqualsRelative(100000000, 100000001, 1e-6);
084//              
085//              double[] a = {1.0000000000, 2, 3, 1000000};
086//              double[] b = {1.0000000001, 2, 3, 1000001};
087//              assertArrayEqualsRelative(a, b, 1e-6);
088//      }
089}
